title: Can not send email after reinstalling Thunderbird
content: I had to wipe out my computer and re-install Thunderbird. Unfortunately, I did not back up the latest Thunderbird profile, but had to use an earlier profile I had backed up. Now I can receive all emails, but cannot send any emails. (I am able to send email through Spectrum webmail.) In Spectrum, I have a main account, and 3 subaccounts. In the Outgoing Server SMPT settings in Thunderbird, where it asks User Name, which email account do I use, the main one or one of the subaccounts? I seems the SMPT setting is for both the main and the three subaccounts, not for each separately. Also, is there something else I need to do as I didn’t back up the latest Thunderbird profile? Thanks!

title: Some folders (e.g. '[Gmail]/All Mail on xxxxxx@gmail.com') cannot be compacted because there is not enough free disk space. Please delete some files and try again.
content:
I get a message like this every time I start Thunderbird. The topic came up last year but the conclusion was along the lines of "...this problem will be fixed in version 128" but it was never clear whether or not the User followed Mozilla's support replies or what they had to do to clear the email message from Thunderbird. .....Well I'm running version 128.1.1esr and the problem still exists.

My questions:

1. What is Thunderbird trying to do? Compact individual email files? Compae from ct the whole Thunderbird Profiles folder?

2. Is the problem the size of the Profiles folder or the overall size of the hard drive the Profiles folder resides on? What is the Hard/solidstate drive is the maximum?

3. Is the problem related to the amount of Free Space left on the Hard/solidstate drive or is the issue the number of individual files?

4. Is the issue related to the number of Thunderbird files and/or folders OR is it related to the total number of files and/or folders on the hard drive?

5. Is there a limit to the number of sub-folder levels that Thunderbird can navigate?

Thank you.

Tom

Tom O'Brien TOBrienArchitect@gmail.com
creator: TOBrienArchitect

title: Cancellazione massiva mail
content:
All'incirca il 20 agosto mi sono accordo che nella Posta di Libero che uso da tantissimi anni e in cui la posta occupava all'incirca 3,5 Giga, lo spazio occupato si era ridotto a circa 700Mega. Il 29 agosto ho attivato una chat di assistenza con libero. Mi hanno detto da fare alcune verifiche sulle impostazioni di Libero e mi hanno chiesto : 

"Utilizzi un Client (Outlook, Thunderbird, Mail…) o la webmail insieme a un client?

Le email restano sui server Libero (nella webmail) se consulti la casella dal sito, oppure da un client o app configurati col protocollo IMAP. Se invece usi (o hai usato) dei client in POP (senza l’opzione per mantenere copia dei messaggi sul server), i messaggi vengono scaricati nel tuo dispositivo (Pc): quindi non saranno più nella webmail (server). Nel caso ti consigliamo di accedere al dispositivo con client POP e verificare nelle "Cartelle locali" o in qualche backup che puoi aver fatto.

Io ho usato Thunderbird una sola volta in giugno quindi molto prima del 20 agosto.

Ho aperto nuovamente Thunderbird (il 29 agosto) per verificare come erano le impostazioni richieste:anche li non vedevo le mail sparite in Libero, ho fatto le verifiche che mi avevano chiesto di fare: il tutto con esito positivo: ho verificato che usa il server: imapmail.libero.it e non c'era nessuna programmazione per cancellare la posta sul server di Libero . A seguito di questo II utilizzo di Thunderbird occupazione della posta era ulteriormente calata: 143Mega. In pratica ho perso quasi tutta la posta comprese le numerose cartelle che mi ero creato per fare ordine nell posta.

LA DOMANDA CHE PONGO è LA SEGUENTE: ESISTE UNA CONFIGURAZIONE DI THUNDERBIRD CHE A SEGUITO DELLA SUA SOLA APERTURA CANCELLA COSì TANTA POSTA (TUTTE LE CARTELLE: QUELLE CREATE PER FARE ORDINE COMPLETAMENTE VUOTE , QUELLA DELLA POSTA ARRIVATA CIRA 200 MAIL SU NON SO QUANTE MIGLIAIA, IDEM SULLA POSTA INVIATA)? O DEVO IMPUTARE A QUANTO è SUCCESSO AD UN BACO DI THUNDERBIRD?
creator: dinogalletti01

title: event invites automatically added to calendar, no accept or decline buttons
content:
Thunderbolt 115.14.0 (64-bit) on Kubuntu 24.04.1 LTS. I have google calendar set using the link https://apidata.googleusercontent.com/caldav/v2/something%40something.com/events/

When I receive an email with an invite (with attached *.ics file) it goes automatically to the calendar (and perhaps is automatically accepted? No way to know). There are not "Accept" or "Decline" buttons.

How do I prevent this behavior? I prefer to first read the invitation email and then decide what to do and whether to add it to a calendar (and accept or decline it)

title: Cannot select sound file for new emails
content:
Hi all,

I'm on TB 128.1.1esr on Windows 10. I recently ported my profile from Debian and everything seems to be working fine except I can't change the route or path to the sound file I was using on linux for new emails, which reads:

file:///home/myusername/Documents/r2d2/r2d2.wav

I want to use that same wav file, but when I click on the "browse" button to set the new route in Windows 10, nothing happens. Other than that, sound is working fine on windows and the rest of the Thunderbird functions seem to be working fine too. Any ideas appreciated, have a good one!

title: thema
content: Hallo,na lang zoeken heb ik gevonden waar ik iets kan veranderen in thema's. Want bij veel thema's veranderd de achtergrond van de berichtkoppen (linkse helft van scherm) in zwart met witte letters wat ik absoluut lelijk vindt! Dus een heel mooi thema (achtergrond bovenaan) maar steeds 90% van de keuzes veranderd alles in zwart links. Nu heb ik gaan zien bij configuratieinstellingen waar het veranderd en heb gevonden dat 'browser.theme.toolbar-theme' ook veranderd met thema ,dus klik ik er achteraan op de regel van 'terugzetten' ( rechterkant) dan wordt alles terug wit ,prachtig want het thema zelf blijft ook aanwezig dus OK! Vraag is echter ,kan ik die regel niet verwijderen of kan ik het niet opslaan want ik met soms terug naar die instelling regel om weer terug te zetten! Bedankt!
